title: Ticket #1130: Add year to timestamps in user logs and dagman.out
description: I just got a request from the Pegasus folks at ISI that we add the year to the timestamps that are output in Condor users logs and the dagman.out file. This seems like something that would be a good idea, but (especially changing the user logs) something that could be a lot trickier than it might seem.
remarks:
2010-Oct-20 16:03:30 by jfrey:
Bulk change of target version from v070504 to v070505 using ./ticket-target-mover.
2011-Jan-27 14:46:04 by danb:
Bulk change of target version from v070505 to v070506 using ./ticket-target-mover.
2011-Feb-01 14:49:30 by tannenba:
Bulk change of target version from v070506 to NULL using ./ticket-target-mover.

2017-Jan-10 11:31:56 by wenger:
As per today's LSST phone conference, this would be useful for them.

Maybe another possibility would be adding the Unix timestamp, which would fix the daylight savings problem (see #1273).

2020-May-26 20:11:11 by jfrey:
This is now possible via configuration. See #6936.
creator: wenger
